snippet: In response to a Freedom of Information Act lawsuit filed by The New York Times, the Obama administration has declassified and released documents related to the Protect America Act in late 2007 and early 2008. The documents fill in a gap in the...
lead_paragraph: In response to a Freedom of Information Act lawsuit filed by The New York Times, the Obama administration has declassified and released documents related to the Protect America Act in late 2007 and early 2008. The documents fill in a gap in the historical record regarding the evolution of the Bush administration’s post-9/11 warrantless surveillance program.

headline.main: U.S. Declassifies FISA Court Documents about the Protect America Act

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
